analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Mānaṁ, bhikkhave, anabhijānaṁ aparijānaṁ tattha cittaṁ avirājayaṁ appajahaṁ abhabbo dukkhakkhayāya.
analyzed: bhikkhave an abhijānam a parijānam tattha cittam a virājayam a pajaham abhabbaḥ dukkha kkhayāya
translated: “Monks, without directly knowing and fully understanding conceit, without making it fade away and giving it up, one is unable to make an end of suffering.

original: Mānañca kho, bhikkhave, abhijānaṁ parijānaṁ tattha cittaṁ virājayaṁ pajahaṁ bhabbo dukkhakkhayāyā”ti.
analyzed: mānam ca kho bhikkhave abhijānam parijānam tattha cittam virājayam pajaham bhabbaḥ dukkha kkhayāya ati
translated: But by directly knowing and fully understanding conceit, by making it fade away and giving it up, one is able to make an end of suffering.”
